Activity: Check emails and address any new issues or requests. Review testing results of the tracking system.
Finalize the centralized tracking system based on the testing results. Ensure data entry is straightforward and reporting capabilities are adequate.

Send the communication to all users, announcing the new data quality issue reporting process and providing instructions on how to submit feedback via the Help Desk system. Include a link to the centralized tracking system (if applicable, otherwise just explain the process).
Monitor the Help Desk system for incoming data quality issue reports. Respond to inquiries and provide guidance as needed.
Begin reviewing initial data quality issue reports received. Prioritize issues based on severity and potential impact on data accuracy.
Start documenting the first few reported data quality issues in the centralized tracking system. Ensure all required fields are completed accurately.
Initiate root cause analysis for the prioritized data quality issues. Begin by gathering relevant information and interviewing stakeholders (e.g., data entry personnel, clinical staff).
